channel.title: Using Stream Isolation Ports on multiple whonix workstations
channel.description:
Hi,
I need some clarification regarding stream isolation & ports in multiple workstations & a single gateway in Qubes.
I use stream isolation extensively to isolate different chat accounts. I use a SocksPort from 10.152.152.10:9153 to 9159 for each separate account as per [the whonix stream isolation doc](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Stream_Isolation)
My question is if I have to re-use one of the aforementioned 7 ports (9153-9159) in a DIFFERENT workstation vm - is it still isolated from the same port in the other workstation when all workstations are going through the same whonix gateway proxyvm??

item.title: Using Stream Isolation Ports on multiple whonix workstations
item.dc:creator: techquest
item.description:
Thanks for the reply - just wanted to check before replicating my setup for others.

Read full topic
item.source: Using Stream Isolation Ports on multiple whonix workstations

item.title: Using Stream Isolation Ports on multiple whonix workstations
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Yes because of Torâ€™s default IsolateClientAddr option as per https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en.

Read full topic
